name: Alex Steinþórsdóttir
bio: Alexandra Dögg Steinþórsdóttir is an illustrator and writer currently living and working in Iceland. She works in various mediums but specializes in watercolours and gouache. Her main influences are Icelandic nature, folklore, social issues and the occult.

name: Vala Steingrímsdóttir
bio:
Vala Steingrimsdóttir is an Icelandic illustrator, comic artist and writer that has a special knack for depicting the beauty of nature and people.

Having spent a lot of time in the countryside of Iceland, she has strong ties with nature and environmental activism. It is reflected in her passion for painting ‘’otherworldly’’ environments and visuals that border on the poetic with vibrant colours and soft rendering. Moreover, climate action and human rights activism regularly carries into her storytelling and collaborations.

She puts a big emphasis on writing impactful stories with grounded and believable characters and also has a passion for the genre of fantasy, which tends to creep into her work. From beautiful escapist adventures ranging from tales of fantastical realms to mythology and folklore from our world, to children's stories about countryside life and her poignant non-fiction adult comics, she makes engaging stories for all ages.

Vala is based in Denmark at this moment in time, but is a child of the world at heart, and hopes that life will take her many places. As this portfolio reveals Iceland will always have the warmest place in her heart and will be an eternal source of inspiration.

Feel free to get in touch! : )

name: Unnur Snorradóttir
bio: Unnur Snorradóttir, an Icelandic artist known for intricate hand sketches and gothic narratives explores modern life, fantasy, and raises awareness of global warming. Snorradóttir’s fast-paced drawing style, heavy on black, brings life to her work. She questions the necessity of perfection, valuing self-expression and creative freedom. Influenced by Iceland’s landscape, her art reflects the urgency of climate change. She spoke with Fluoro.

name: Ymir Arnarson
bio:
I am an Icelandic American cartoonist/graphic novelist with a fierce passion for American cartoons.

I have studied Graphic Storytelling in Denmark and worked with Italian, French, Australian, Portuguese, Finnish, Swedish, German, and Australian story artists for the last five years leading up to my graduation. I think the stories I tell are reflective of these international friends and the intricate connections between our cultures.

Comparing cultures has inspired me to write stories ranging from friends struggling with student debt during their weekly roleplaying game, to exploring the hearts of an isolated father and angry son through a portal world in the woods.

In my own life, living in America, I sometimes felt like a foreigner in my own country. But in moving between these various worlds, I've found a voice that people can relate to as we all become more and more connected with the world and each other.

Email: ymirarnarson@gmail.com

Social: @ymirarnarson

name: Dýrfinna Benita
bio: „Ég sæki innblástur úr öllum áttum og vinir mínir veita mér mikinn innblástur. Ég er svo heppin með vini. En ég vinn mikið út frá lífi mínu og reynslu í verkum mínum svo innblásturinn er allstaðar. Sjónvarp hefur sömuleiðis mikil áhrif á mig, þar get ég nefnt td. The Powerpuff Girls sem mótaði mig og barnæsku mína Listin er eitt af því sem heldur mér gangandi, ég læri alltaf eitthvað nýtt og þroskast með hverju verki. Ég elska að skapa þó svo það geti verið erfitt. Svo dýrka að eyða tíma með vinum mínum í JPT stál, þeir eru algjörir snillingar og hafa veitt mér ómetanlegan stuðning, lærdóm og innblástur í gegnum ferðalagið mitt með stálið […] Besta ráðið er: ímyndaðu þér hvað manneskja með sjálfstraust myndi gera og gerðu það“

name: Ari Hlynur Yates
bio: I'm an Icelandic illustrator, author and designer living and working in Denmark. I specialize children's books.

name: Jólaljósamaðurinn
bio: Á æskuárum sínum var Jólaljósamaðurinn með ofurhetjur á heilanum. Dag einn í aðdraganda jóla féll hann af þaki þar sem hann var að setja upp jólaljós en það vildi honum til happs að flækjast í ljósasnúrunum. Í kjölfarið ákvað hann að gerast ofurhetja sjálfur..

name: Natka Klimowicz
bio:
My name is Natka Klimowicz and I'm a poster designer and an illustrator based in Reykjavik. 

Graduated from University of Arts in Poznan, with MA in graphic design and BA in printmaking.

They say less is more, I say more (color!) is more.

Here to speak visual language for grassroots organizations, minorities and anyone who likes things to look fun. Art + good cause = say no more! Ask me for a poster anytime (✧ᴥ✧)

Turn on. Tune in. Drop me a line.  klimowicz.nat@gmail.com

name: Björn Heimir Önundarson
bio:
Björn Heimir Önundarson (b. 1996) is a cartoonist, illustrator, animator and a painter.
Björn has mainly been making animation short films and doing cartoons for the Morgunblaðið newspaper the past few years, but has also worked in various areas such as making and releasing comics, posters, album covers and other assignments.
Björn graduated from the Reykjavík School of visual arts in 2018.
